meanings.definition: Lacking good manners or refinement; rude.
meanings.sent1: The uncouth man spoke loudly in the quiet library.
meanings.sent2: She found his uncouth behavior at the dinner party quite embarrassing.
meanings.sent3: Despite his uncouth manners, he always remembered to say please and thank you.
meanings.sent4: Her uncouth way of eating reminded him of a wild animal.
meanings.sent5: The uncouth guest belched loudly at the formal event, shocking everyone.

meanings.definition: Awkward or clumsy in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The uncouth chair wobbled whenever someone sat on it.
meanings.sent2: The painting looked uncouth with its uneven lines and smudged colors.
meanings.sent3: His uncouth attempt at dancing made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The uncouth tree branches reached out like twisted fingers in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The uncouth sculpture seemed to defy gravity with its odd angles and curves.
